thread.title: Unexploded WW2 bomb brings UK city to standstill | Daily Star
thread.title_full: Unexploded WW2 bomb brings UK city to standstill | Daily Star

author: Alex Hickson
title: Unexploded WW2 bomb brings UK city to standstill | Daily Star
text:
How destructive is a nuclear weapon? The TERRIFYING images of Hiroshima and Nagasaki Thursday, 9th February 2017 There is a reason people fear nuclear war – the weapons are now so powerful they could wipe out humanity. The bombs dropped on Nagasaki and Hiroshima are tiny by comparison to the destructive power of modern nuclear weapons – which are thought to be over 3000 times more powerful. 1 / 12 The mushroom cloud over Nagasaki, viewed from the ground. “The German SC250 bomb was found in the early hours of this morning” Navy spokesman 
A Navy spokesman said: "The German SC250 bomb was found in the early hours of this morning in the excavator head of a barge dredging the harbour - part of a raft of infrastructure upgrades taking place in readiness for the arrival of the Royal Navy's new 65,000-tonne aircraft carrier. 
"Divers from the Royal Navy's Portsmouth-based Southern Diving Unit 2 are on the scene." 
They added: "Please be aware unexploded ordnance has been located during an ongoing dredging operation to prepare for new Royal Navy aircraft carriers in Portsmouth Harbour." 
Travel chaos caused by the cordon has brought much of the city's traffic to a halt. 
Ferries to and from the Isle of Wight to the city may be cancelled. 
This is the third similar device found in the harbour in the last four months. Related articles
